required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: LODS Role in Predicting 30-day Mortality Outcome in ICU
clinical_study.official_title: Logistic Organ Dysfunction System Role in Predicting 30-day Mortality Outcome in Intensive Care Unit of dr. Cipto Mangunkusumo General Hospital Patients

brief_summary.textblock: LODS score for deceased ICU patients within 30 days is higher than survived ICU patients

primary_outcome.description: LODS score ability to discriminate patient outcomes based on variables of logistic organ dysfunction system scores: GCS; heart rate; systolic BP; blood urea; serum creatinine; urine output; leucocyte count; platelet count; PaO2/FiO2; serum bilirubin; prothrombin time.

LODS score ability to predict patient outcomes based on variables of logistic organ dysfunction system scores: GCS; heart rate; systolic BP; blood urea; serum creatinine; urine output; leucocyte count; platelet count; PaO2/FiO2; serum bilirubin; prothrombin time.

primary_outcome.measure: Correlation between LODS score variables with patient outcome
primary_outcome.description: Correlation between patient outcomes with each LODS score variables: GCS; heart rate; systolic BP; blood urea; serum creatinine; urine output; leucocyte count; platelet count; PaO2/FiO2; serum bilirubin; prothrombin time.

secondary_outcome.description: Patient outcome within 30 days of admission to intensive care unit (ICU): deceased or survived

secondary_outcome.measure: LODS neurologic variable score: Glasgow Coma Scale (GCS)
LODS cardiovascular variable score: Heart rate (HR) and/or systolic blood pressure (SBP)
LODS renal variable score: serum urea nitrogen (BUN) and/or creatinine and/or urine output (UO)
LODS pulmonary variable score: Partial oxygen pressure (PaO2)/Fraction of inspired oxygen (FiO2) on Mechanical Ventilation (MV) or Continuous Positive Airway Pressure (CPAP)
LODS hematologic variable score: white blood cell (WBC) count and/or platelet count
LODS hepatic function variable score: Serum Bilirubin and/or Prothrombin time (PT)

intervention.description: Variables of logistic organ dysfunction system score, including: GCS; heart rate; systolic BP; blood urea; serum creatinine; urine output; leucocyte count; platelet count; PaO2/FiO2; serum bilirubin; prothrombin time.

study_pop.textblock: intensive care unit patients medical records

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- adult patient (age 18 years and above) admitted to ICU
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients admitted to ICU due to burn injury, coronary artery disease, post cardiac surgery
- patients with incomplete required information for LODS score
- patients deceased or discharged less than 24 hours of admission
